benchmark_details.name: Kvasir-VQA-x1
benchmark_details.overview: Kvasir-VQA-x1 is a new, large-scale dataset for gastrointestinal (GI) endoscopy designed to benchmark reasoning-intensive visual question answering in medical contexts, incorporating 159,549 new question-answer pairs and a variety of visual augmentations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a clinically relevant benchmark for visual question answering in medical imaging to improve AI application in gastroenterology.

data.source: The dataset builds upon the original Kvasir-VQA dataset, derived from HyperKvasir and Kvasir-Instrument, containing images from GI endoscopy procedures.
data.annotation: Generated and validated by medical experts to ensure clinical relevance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using established formulas providing insight into performance concerning ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Quantifying correct responses against set criteria, focusing on clinical reasoning capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance evaluated against MedGemma and Qwen2.5-VL models.
methodology.validation: Robustness tested through standard and transformed evaluation settings.
